results.title: Crossing the Great Sagrada
results.creator_credit: Priceless Pictures, All-Britisch Productions, Adrian Brunel and Lionel Rich
results.brief_description: In 1924, during one of the periodic slumps in the British film industry, Adrian Brunel amused himself and many others by producing a series of burlesques. This film tells of Holmes, Sweet and Holmes’ voyage by sea to Africa where they then set off, on camels, across the desert to finally arrive at the famous Cascara of Sagrada falls. A comic travel film of the silent era.

results.title: Crossing borders
results.creator_credit: Film Project for Women's History and Future, Linda Balek, Barbara Laing and Jeanne Kracher
results.brief_description: The story of the Women’s International League for Peace and Freedom, the longest standing organisation of its kind. Begun during the first World War and still alive all around the world, the WILPF is a testament to women’s historic resistance to militarism and oppression. Despite their important place in history, the WILPF’s study has, until now, remained buried. “Crossing Borders” uncovers this dramatic and forgotten chapter in history.

results.title: Crosses
results.brief_description: A documentary that examines the experiences of Australian soldiers fighting in the Middle East and at Gallipoli during World War 1, between 1914-1918. Archival film footage shows the conditions on the battlefields, and ex-soldiers recount their experiences.

results.title: Cross your heart and hope to live
results.creator_credit: Danish Heart Foundation and Bert Christensen
results.brief_description: Looks at the rising incidence of heart disease in Western society. Of babies born with perfect arteries, by the age of 15 virtually everybody has ruined them to some extent. Points out that the “good life” is responsible - smoking, lack of physical activity, excess fatty substances in the blood, high blood pressure and overweight are to blame. Suggestions are made for overcoming the problem.

results.title: Cross my heart
results.creator_credit: Jocelyn Moorhouse, Andrew Wiseman, David Swann and Open Channel Productions
results.brief_description: Two women attending a friend’s funeral who died from cancer vow to quit smoking, cold turkey. There are obstacles in their way however, including a sister who has just split up with her partner, her son in tow. They instil a no smoking policy in the house with penalties for those who break the rules. Features salient points about the ill effects of smoking and the side effects you can expect when quitting. Cast includes: Marilyn O’Donnell, Parthena Amanatidis, Tamasin Ramsay, Brian Nankervis.

results.title: Cross currents
results.brief_description:
An image from a newspaper featuring Eastern European women being forced into prostitution and slavery at the end of the Yugoslav-Serbo-Croatian war, sets the scene for the Cross Currents exhibition. Presented in two sections, interactive video and linear video, as well as being in English and German language, events are recreated leading up to a police raid on a sex slave hotel in Berlin. The raid is recreated from the opposing points of view of an enslaved Croatian sex worker and her Serbian bodyguard.

Cross Currents premiered at ZKM, Centre for Art and Media, Karlsruhe, Germany in 1999.

results.title: Cross country runner
results.creator_credit: Department of Theatre Arts, University of California and Mark McCarty
results.brief_description: A light-hearted allegorical spoof of modern society, depicting the trials and tribulations of a cross-country runner who takes time out from a race to visit friends and family. Cast includes David Aldrich.

results.title: Cross and passion
results.creator_credit: BFI, Kim Longinotto and Claire Pollak
results.brief_description: The women of Northern Ireland tell their stories in this film shot in the troubled Catholic ghetto area of West Belfast. Shows how life for Women in Belfast’s ghettos is dominated by the contrasting power of the church and army.

results.title: Cronos = La Invencion de Cronos [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Iguana Productions (MX), Arthur H Gorson, Bertha Navarro and Guillermo del Toro
results.brief_description: Guillermo Del Toro’s feature debut takes classic vampire mythology into unusual and unexpected terrain. The Cronos of the film’s title is an ornate and intricate beetle shaped device which houses an ancient slug like insect, which once attached to its host, has similar side effects to vampirism. Designed by a 16th century alchemist, the thought to be lost contraption resurfaces in contemporary Mexico and falls into the hands of antique dealer, Jesus Gris (Federico Luppi). The old man, fascinated by its ornate and mysterious beauty, decides to hold on to it, oblivious to its destructive power. However, he is not the only one aware of the Cronos’ existence and soon finds himself being pursued by a dying millionaire (Claudio Brook) and his violent henchman (Ron Perlman). Del Toro’s screenplay takes a sombre and quirky approach to the themes of death and immortality but at it’s heart rests a touching portrait of Jesus’s relationship with his mostly silent but protective granddaughter, Aurora (Tamara Shanath). In Spanish and English with English subtitles.

results.title: Cromwell
results.creator_credit: Irving Allen, Ken Hughes and Columbia
results.brief_description: The last flourish of the decadent Cavaliers, the obdurate zeal of the insurgent Puritans, the mighty clashes in Parliament and on the battlefields, the king’s death on the headsman’s block - a crucial phase of British history is encompassed in “Cromewell”. This powerful story unfolds majestically against a backdrop of pageant, bloody battle and the agonies of a country torn by civil war. Stars Alec Guinness as Charles I and Richard Harris as Oliver Cromwell with a distinguished supporting cast.
